item.title: Debugging a robot in simulation before you burn wires
item.description: Hardware does not come with an undo button. Once you power it on, mistakes—from reversed wiring to faulty code—can result in costly damage. Motors may overheat, printed circuit boards (PCBs) can be fried, and sensors may break. These issues turn exciting projects into frustrating repair sessions.
